qas.question: Humans in the Balkans have been dated to what year?
Evidence of the earliest humans were found in what subterranean formation?
The Franchthi cave has evidence of what 3 ancient eras?
Greece has evidence of Stone Age people during what time period?
What activity led to Greece having some of the earliest Stone Age settlements?

context: The earliest evidence of the presence of human ancestors in the southern Balkans, dated to <a0_0>270,000 BC<a0_0/>, is to be found in the <a1_0>Petralona cave<a1_0/>, in the Greek province of Macedonia. All three stages of the stone age (<a2_0>Paleolithic, Mesolithic, and Neolithic<a2_0/>) are represented in Greece, for example in the Franchthi Cave. Neolithic settlements in Greece, dating from the <a3_0>7th millennium BC<a3_0/>, are the oldest in Europe by several centuries, as Greece lies on the route via which <a4_0>farming<a4_0/> spread from the Near East to Europe.
